website_summaries.verdict: The Intel Core i3-4330 is the budget CPU to get for general computing and light workloads.
pros: Supports Intel's Advanced Vector Extensions (AVX2) and Hyper-Threading
cons: Weaker graphics performance than the competition

customer_reviews.title: Good processor, good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is working well in a mini-ITX hackintosh build, installed in a Gigabyte GA-H87N-WIFI motherboard. Powered with a PicoPSU 160XT power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Craig W. French

customer_reviews.title: All you probably need for your desktop
customer_reviews.text: Great efficiency! I went with a lower power Core i3 dual core vs a Core i5, and I'm glad I did. Runs office applications just fine. Couple it with a GTX 750 video card if you want to play intense games without wasting power. I really wish I had bought an SSD for my desktop. The CPU fan on this thing is so quiet that the mechanical hard drive sounds really loud now.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a mid-range gaming system.
customer_reviews.text: Don't let people fool you, this isn't your Clarkdale i3, it's a dual core beast. I built a small steam box with my old ATI 5870, and am able to comfortably run most games at mid to high settings at 1080p. If you're making a higher end machine then consider the Haswell i5, but don't think for a second that this chip isn't capable at doing some serious gaming at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent M Pickering

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu for the price. Intel does it right.
customer_reviews.text: I almost went with an i5, but trying to stay in a budget, I went with the i3. This cpu is solid. OS install went very fast, and web surfing doesn't effect the performance one bit. I have 8gb of system memory installed, and running a 240ssd. Great combo. I will buy again for my customers.
customer_reviews.author: Mcomeau

customer_reviews.title: Love this processor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to build a low-power gaming box. The entire machine idles at about 20 Watts and only uses about 35 Watts flat out. Plenty of horsepower and I'm very impressed. I had intended to add a discrete GPU but the Intel graphics are doing fine (at lower resolutions).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intel CPUs are rock solid. Had this on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Intel CPUs are rock solid. Had this on my HTPC for awhile now and doesn't miss a beat. Plenty fast for HD movie playback.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: This processor is an efficient and affordable powerhouse!
customer_reviews.text: Cool, fast and powerful. Much better balanced than its predecessors thanks to the improved Intel Processor Graphics. Would recommend for HTPC, general use or home made console / emulation machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Schweeeeeet CPU
customer_reviews.text: Got this process for a NAS box. Processor worked great out of the box. Enough processing power for my purposes. Integrated graphics are nice since I don't really need a video card.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic processor. Combined with a Gigabyte brand motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic processor. Combined with a Gigabyte brand motherboard, this thing runs OSX as well or better than a real Mac. Using the onboard HD 4600 graphics. Love it. Very very fast! Very low power draw too.
customer_reviews.author: UnaClocker

customer_reviews.title: Great budget CPU that I can upgrade later if needed
customer_reviews.text: Built a budget gamer system just for League of Legends and this was the cpu choice. The on-chip video capabilitys give me a great gaming experience for LOL. I will upgrade to a later haswell i7 if I need to but for now this dual core chip runs great.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Adams

customer_reviews.title: This guy works great for home computing
customer_reviews.text: This guy works great for home computing. I run semi-complex programs like Adobe Apps and 3D Sketchup. Rendering never lags. Graphics look great with on-board chip. So far so good! Perfect for a Budget Build.
customer_reviews.author: Adam L

customer_reviews.title: More than expected from i3
customer_reviews.text: I expected low power from an i3 and was surprised. This little i3 has very low power consumption and is able to play most modern games. I have only once or twice thought I needed more power. I am very glad I didn't go all out with an i7 sucking 130 watts.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great HTPC processor
customer_reviews.text: I got the i3 for my HTPC and love it. It lower power so it run cool and quiet but if I throw something at it that involves a little more power it can handle it. Love the processor so far.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P

customer_reviews.title: great little processor
customer_reviews.text: I have built two systems, one with the i3-4330, and the other with the i5 Haswell. I cannot tell the difference between the two. I use the onboard graphics, and they work just fine. Good processor for building Hackintosh.
customer_reviews.author: Double Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for setting up a Sophos UTM box to increase your network security!
customer_reviews.text: great little processor for low intensity work. I used this in a box I set up as a Sophos UTM. Not the fasted processor out there, but it does what it's supposed to and does it well
customer_reviews.author: Chief Points

customer_reviews.title: good product, work as expected with good performance
customer_reviews.text: work as expected with good performance and low power. I measured about 55Watts on desktop with Intel 530 SSD, 4GB RAM, Intel i3-4330, MSI H87M G43, with 15" Philips LCD
customer_reviews.author: ibnu harjanto

customer_reviews.title: While I wished I could have afforded to purchase a ...
customer_reviews.text: While I wished I could have afforded to purchase a larger one, I'm very impressed with this. It delivers everything it says it can. Strong and very speedy!
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great processor and is definitely a step up from my old AMD CPU. I paired it with a Gigabyte GA-H81M motherboard, 8GB Kingston HyperX FURY RAM and an EVGA 430W PSU. So far it has exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: May not be the best value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good CPU but you may find the i3-4360 is available for a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: mit_banana

customer_reviews.title: faster than my "old" Core i5
customer_reviews.text: Very good performance for the money, runs cool with my Noctua heat sink installed. I don't see the need for a faster processor for everyday computing, office work and surfing.
customer_reviews.author: In His Name

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming CPU
customer_reviews.text: Got this CPU to power an eventual Steam Machine, but right now I have it doing work for a Windows 8.1 SFF gaming computer. Paired it with 8GB of DDR3 1600 RAM, a Radeon 7850 2GB OC, and an H61 based mITX mainboard. Currently averages around 150-200+ fps in CSGO at 1080p max settings and ~60-100 fps in BF4 at 1080p medium/high mixed settings. All in all, the entire build cost me about $400 or so to put together. Very happy with the price/performance ratio.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: My best investment
customer_reviews.text: I make some online reviews on uP performance from several brands and references, comparing cost/profit rate, I found this was one with the higher rate due to its lower price and HT capability. It has great performance, I work with rendering and 3D modeling.
customer_reviews.author: AlexCumbal

customer_reviews.title: Well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I used this CPU on a budget pc, and it turned out to perform a lot better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Powerful enough for my needs, does what it's supposed to do, and doesn't use too much energy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, this is an excellent processor for the price. It's fast and runs cool with stock fan. I have not complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to decide whether I would go with a slower 4 core or a faster two core. This processor surprised me, I thought it would be a dog, slow as molasses. Compared to my other systems, which are high end i7s, this is definitely not as fast, but it's not embarrassingly slow either. Would I put this in my high end gaming rig? No way. Would I put this in an everyday pc for light/casual gaming and movie watching, web surfing? Absolutely.
customer_reviews.author: Amerikagin

customer_reviews.title: Great processor for my build.
customer_reviews.text: Great Price for Intel and the product is everything that I expected it would be. Very happy and would recommend this to anyone who is looking to build a PC in the $500-600 price range.
customer_reviews.author: shayann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Enough power for me, an entertainment user. My new computer runs really fast with this high end i3 processor. Love Intel processors.
customer_reviews.author: Sarasota Man

customer_reviews.title: Solid CPU
customer_reviews.text: Using this in a HTPC running Ubuntu 15.04. Right now it's just handing video playback and ripping my DVD and Bluray collection to digital formats. Performance is great so far, and it's not putting off to much heat even when under a heavy load. The head sync fan is inaudible so it doesn't disrupt the movie experience at all.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Work fine
customer_reviews.text: Get's the job done, it is what it is. Not the fastest processor, but works as expected. I havent use the Intel 4600 GPU
customer_reviews.author: jpenguin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works as expected... bits and bytes all about really quickly.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: STOLEN BEFORE PACKAGED
customer_reviews.text: Processor arrived on time just as expected but when i went to open it. It appeared to be stolen. THANKS THIS WAS A LITTLE GIRLS X-MAS PRESENT.
customer_reviews.author: white

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a family computer or media center
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to build for my family and uncle's mini PC. It works incredibly well for basic tasks, up to basic video conversions and light gaming. (Converting videos to iPod/iphone and League of legends.) If you are looking for a family rig, this is the best CPU for the price. If you are also looking to make a hackintosh, this works with the Mac OSX system.
customer_reviews.author: Caohu09

product_meta.title: Intel BX80646I34330 - Core i3 (4330) 3.5GHz Processor 4MB L3 Cache 54W (Boxed)
